block.p: YANKEES-- Placed RHP Ramiro Mendoza on the 15-day disabled list retroactive to June 25. BALTIMORE ORIOLES--Placed 3B Cal Ripken on the 15-day disabled list. Recalled 3B Ryan Minor from Rochester of the International League. Assigned RHP Darren Holmes to Rochester. CLEVELAND INDIANS--Recalled RHP Kane Davis from Buffalo of the International League. Optioned RHP Paul Rigdon to Buffalo. Sent RHP Jaime Navarro outright to Buffalo. KANSAS CITY ROYALS--Sent C Brian Johnson and RHP Miguel Batista outright to Omaha of the PCL. Recalled RHP Doug Bochtler and C Jorge Fabregas from Omaha.

YANKEES-- Placed RHP Ramiro Mendoza on the 15-day disabled list retroactive to June 25. BALTIMORE ORIOLES--Placed 3B Cal Ripken on the 15-day disabled list. Recalled 3B Ryan Minor from Rochester of the International League. Assigned RHP Darren Holmes to Rochester. CLEVELAND INDIANS--Recalled RHP Kane Davis from Buffalo of the International League. Optioned RHP Paul Rigdon to Buffalo. Sent RHP Jaime Navarro outright to Buffalo. KANSAS CITY ROYALS--Sent C Brian Johnson and RHP Miguel Batista outright to Omaha of the PCL. Recalled RHP Doug Bochtler and C Jorge Fabregas from Omaha.

COLORADO ROCKIES--Promoted 3B Sam Smith from Asheville of the South Atlantic League to Salem of the Carolina League. LOS ANGELES DODGERS--Placed RHP Jeff Shaw on the 15-day disabled list, retroactive to June 27. Recalled RHP Jamie Arnold from Albuquerque of the PCL. ST. LOUIS CARDINALS--Traded RHP Darren Holmes to Baltimore for future considerations.

NETS--Announced the retirement of F Jayson Williams. Named Tim Walsh trainer. CHICAGO BULLS--Traded the rights to C Chris Mihm to Cleveland for the rights to G Jamal Crawford and cash. DALLAS MAVERICKS--Traded a future first-round draft pick and cash to Orlando for the rights to G Courtney Alexander. Traded F Sean Rooks to the Los Angeles Clippers for G Eric Murdock. Traded the rights to F Dan Langhi to Houston for the rights to F Eduardo Najera and a future second-round draft pick. HOUSTON ROCKETS--Traded the rights to C Joel Przybilla to Milwaukee for the rights to C Jason Collier and a future first-round draft pick. LOS ANGELES LAKERS--Waived F A.C. Green. Traded two future second-round draft picks to the San Antonio Spurs for the rights to G Corey Hightower. ORLANDO MAGIC--Traded F Corey Maggette, F Derek Strong, the rights to G Keyon Dooling and cash to the Los Angeles Clippers for a future first-round draft pick. SEATTLE SUPERSONICS--Traded the rights to G Josip Sesar for two future second-round draft picks.
WNBA--Fined Phoenix coach Cheryl Miller $500 for making derogatory remarks about the officiating after a game on June 25.
SAN DIEGO CHARGERS--Agreed to terms with LB Deon Humphrey on a one-year contract.
LOS ANGELES KINGS--Exercised their option on C Bob Corkum. MINNESOTA WILD--Signed F Wes Walz. WASHINGTON CAPITALS--Re-signed RW Joe Sacco to a two-year contract.

BINGHAMTON STATE--Named Randy Dunton men's assistant basketball coach. CORNELL--Named Christine Keeley Bates women's assistant soccer coach and men's tennis coach Barry Schoonmaker manager of Reis Tennis Center. DARTMOUTH--Named Amy Fowler field hockey coach and Kate Graw women's assistant lacrosse coach. GEORGIA--Named Todd McCorkle women's golf coach. LEBANON VALLEY--Named Gregg Matalas sports information director. MANHATTAN--Named Joe DeAntonio women's assistant basketball coach. MINNESOTA--Named Natasha Freimark director of marketing and corporate sponsorships for women's athletics. NEW ENGLAND COLLEGE--Named Christine Hodgdon women's lacrosse coach and assistant athletic director, Carrah Fisk women's soccer and softball coach and Gino Valente men's basketball coach. OREGON STATE--Named Jenny Condon assistant softball coach. SAINT PETER'S--Promoted Lou Zampella to defensive coordinator. Named Jon Chevalier running backs coach and running game coordinator and Troy Lehrer receivers coach. Reassigned Erik Van Boeckel from receivers coach to quarterbacks coach. SIENA--Named Theresa Wenzel assistant director of athletics for business operations. UTAH--Named Robert Wagner assistant softball coach. VANDERBILT--Named Jim Booz director of compliance. WOFFORD--Named Rod Ray men's and women's tennis coach.
